message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1300000. I believe it's a fair price considering its value to you. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1100000. I believe this is a more reasonable price considering the value of the product to me.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $1100000 is simply too low for me.  How about we meet in the middle?  I'm willing to lower my price to $1250000. This still gives you a good deal and allows me to make a reasonable profit.

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit hesitant to pay $1250000. How about we try to get closer to my original offer of $1100000? I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $1175000. Can you consider this compromise?

Bob, I'm willing to be flexible, but I'm still not comfortable going below $1200000. This is my absolute bottom line.  I believe we can both benefit from this deal, and I'm confident that the product will be worth more than that to you in the long run. What do you say?
I understand your concerns, but I'm still not comfortable paying $1200000. I'm willing to compromise further and offer $1180000. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
